entry.content:
This free-to-play text-based adventure game set in the mostly-flat, circular world-supported-by-elephants-on-a-space-turtle conceived by the late Sir Terry Pratchett has been running since 1992. I had the privilege of becoming a member of the development team in 2023 and learned some aging C# systems for creating content therein.

The development team is incredibly encouraging and welcoming to new developers, and the community still thrives after 30 years, with things like Kefka's map & item database (left, the map of Ankh-Morpork) or Quow's dedicated MUSHclient package replete with various plugins that allow the playerbase to engage with a number of QoL improvements.

GNU Terry Pratchett.

entry.content:
I started at Opus 2 in 2012 as a temp. Within half a year I was in their technical team, delivering hardware solutions for court and arbitration transcriptions, and helping pioneer the prototype of their flagship product, Magnum, a unified legal proceedings platform for evidence, arguments, transcripts, comms, etc.

In the five years that followed, I prepared the Singapore office and trained staff in the Singapore supreme court, and provided on-site assistance at private arbitration sites including Osaka, Miami, Geneva, the Hague, and even St. Vincent & the Grenadines.

When I was not globetrotting or working in the courts, I provided internal IT support, assisted with production and delivery of printed and digital transcripts, produced 3D marketing videos to demonstrate new product solutions, and kept morale up running after-hours tabletop games nights midweek.

I departed Opus 2 in 2017 when I was headhunted by a different firm.

entry.content:
I joined Harney Westwood & Riegels LLP as a Contract Express specialist, converting complex legal & government forms into human-readable documents. After six months, I transitioned into IT, becoming lead Operations Engineer for the London, Luxembourg and Cyprus offices, and providing support for the Hong Kong, British Virgin Islands & Cayman Islands offices.

I served as a fixture of the IT department and assisted staff in all twelve of our office sites through the ticketing system and on the phone. I led deployment of multiple IT systems, and wrote various papers on how to improve processes.

In this role I took ownership of Airwatch and on-site biometric security. During the COVID-19 pandemic, I supported Horizon virtual desktop infrastructure, distributed home office hardware, and was first point of contact for new user inductions across the three European offices.

I left Harneys in August 2022 to briefly join The Game Band, returning in 2024.

entry.content:
I had been doing volunteer work with Blaseball from September of 2020; in August of 2022, I quit my existing job, and by December I was working for TGB on contract.

Together with the six other paid members of the community team, and 21 volunteers, we successfully wrangled the whims of 30,000+ people in a Discord server, fostering communication skills and a caring attitude in the community as a whole while still maintaining an individual competitive spirit for each of the 24 teams.

While in this role I worked with a Discord bot called Carl, personally setting up over 120 unique Tagscript snippets enabling members to interact with the bot and each other. I also supplemented existing graphics by producing Discord "banners" in Photoshop, highlighting recent important events in the game or community.

Blaseball was cancelled on June 2nd, 2023, and I moved back to IT work.
